Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2011 04:01PM Shonda35 wrote: I am going through same thing. My left breast is noticabley bigger than right, my discharge is greenish yellow and I have lump but most of all is the pain and now the waiting to know. I had clinical breast exam done yesterday and have to wait for a mammogram and I am scared silly. I hope yours are hormones and nothing else. I will pray for you cause I know its scary. {{{{HUGS}}}}
Posts.Title: Anxious and terrified... blueberrygirl Shonda35

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2011 02:26PM Shonda35 wrote: I live in Texas the dallas fort worth area and because I am going through Moncreif Cancer Center they have to work you in and she said I was lucky to get what appt I had cause they are booking into august appointments already and I am grateful to get a mammogram since I cannot afford the testing myself but the wait is hard.....I just want to know and hopefully its NOT bc but I will know what it is whether its cysts or whatever and get some relief  for my dear boobies and quit making myself sick with worry. It does hurt so I guess thats a good thing!
Posts.Title: seeking information for my many symptoms please and thank you Shonda35 kira1234

Posts.Content: Shonda35 wrote: I am a 35 yr old mom of 4 boys. I had a breast reduction done 5 yrs ago and lost feeling in sides of my breast and had burning sensation pain in my left breast for about a year, thought I was finally getting some feeling coming back, my cousin was diagnosed with bc from a painful little knot that she found. Her dr told her bc doesnt hurt so she wasnt worried and nobody went with her to dr and it was bc. Her diagnosis made me realize I havent done breast exam myself and that maybe this burning throbbing pain I might need to so that night in bath I thought I would....looking down at my boobs I noticed my left breast the nipple was kinda inverted so I grabbed it to pull it out and had small discharge that was greenish, kinda worried me since I havent breast fed in 8 yrs but still didnt think much of it noticed I couldnt finish breast exam cause burning pain kinda like ripping sensation was too much in my left boobie. this past few months my left breast has grown over cup size bigger than right one and its so noticable to look at them and feels kinda engorged and uncomfortable. I am self employed so I dont have insurance so I saw ad in paper for free mobile mammogram coming to town and called them, they made me appointment for clinical breast exam which was this morning and as I just found this weekend and the dr today found I have a peanut size hard knot on my breast kinda towards under arm which he says is suspious and wants diagnostic mamogram done. Now since I dont have insurance I have to wait a little over month for an appointment. Waiting is horrrible and I have searched the internet which in turn has given me mixed signals....yes I have some worrisome symptoms (change in breast size, nipple discharge, inverted nipple and lump) but they could be anything but most say bc doesnt hurt which would be comforting but since my cousins did I dont know if she was exception to that rule. The internet along with my throbbing boobie pain has gotten me depressed which is silly I know but none the less and having to wait a month or more to find out doesnt help. I want to know before you were diagnosed if you had pain or throbbing sensation as a symptom. I just need temporary peace of mind until I can get actual testing to get peace of mind. thank you for reading my story and taking time to help Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: seeking information for my many symptoms please and thank you Shonda35 kira1234

Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2011 07:31AM Shonda35 wrote: had my diag mammo today and radiologist didnt want ultrasound (see newer post) so I thought that was good but what about my lumps? are they normal or cysts if they are normal and didnt need ultrasound why wouldnt they tell me so I dont have to play the waiting game?
Posts.Title: seeking information for my many symptoms please and thank you Shonda35 kira1234

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2011 08:25AM Shonda35 wrote: thank you, I just dont know whats normal or a symptom or whats its a symptom of so I read up on breast symptoms and alot of stuff points to "C" which is so scary, its made me have to think "what if" and worse case scenario and if I can deal.....and honestly I cant! I want to see my oldest son walk across the stage next May, I want see grandkids and my youngest son now 6 turn 18 to see what kind of man he turns out to be, if my worries turn to reality...I will not go down without a fight but its made me realize that we are not guaranteed a tomorrow....ever...I never thought "bc" would be in my lifes immediate catagory  and I know have a new respect not just sympathy for you diagnosed ladies, its a hard reality and it isnt fair at all. I will be glad to know either way..waiting is so nerve-racking...and glad to know that if I need it I now have a place where friends know and really understand the struggle.
Posts.Title: seeking information for my many symptoms please and thank you Shonda35 kira1234
